      • renew

        public long renew(net.jini.id.Uuid cookie,
                  long extension)
           throws net.jini.core.lease.LeaseDeniedException,
                  net.jini.core.lease.UnknownLeaseException,
                  RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Called by the lease when its renew method is called. Renews the lease that is associated with the given cookie.
        Specified by:
        renew in interface org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Parameters:
        cookie - the Uuid associated with the lease who's renew method was called
        extension - argument passed to the renew call
        Returns:
        The new duration the lease should have
        Throws:
        net.jini.core.lease.LeaseDeniedException - if the landlord is unwilling to renew the lease
        net.jini.core.lease.UnknownLeaseException - if landlord does not know about a lease with the specified cookie
        RemoteException - if a communications failure occurs

      • renewAll

        public org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord.RenewResults renewAll(net.jini.id.Uuid[] cookies,
                                                                long[] extensions)
                                                         throws RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Called by the lease map when its renewAll method is called. Should renew the lease that is associated with each element of cookies
        Specified by:
        renewAll in interface org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Parameters:
        cookies - an array of Uuids, each universally and uniquely identifying a lease granted by this Landlord
        extensions - an array of longs, each representing an a duration in milliseconds that the client wants the lease associated with the Uuid from the corresponding element of cookies renewed for
        Returns:
        A RenewResults object that contains the new duration of each lease that was successfully renewed or the exception encountered for each lease that could not be renewed
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if a communications failure occurs

      • cancel

        public void cancel(net.jini.id.Uuid cookie)
            throws net.jini.core.lease.UnknownLeaseException
        Description copied from interface: org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Called by the lease when its cancel method is called. Cancels the lease that is associated with the given cookie.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        cookie - the Uuid associated with the lease who's renew method was called
        Throws:

      • cancelAll

        public Map cancelAll(net.jini.id.Uuid[] cookies)
        Description copied from interface: org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Called by the lease map when its cancelAll method is called. Should cancel the lease that is associated with each element of cookies
        Specified by:
        cancelAll in interface org.apache.river.landlord.Landlord
        Parameters:
        cookies - an array of Uuids, each universally and uniquely identifying a lease granted by this Landlord
        Returns:
        If all the leases specified in the cookies could be cancelled return null. Otherwise, return a Map that for each failed cancel attempt maps the corresponding cookie object to an exception describing the failure.

      • start

        public final void start()
                 throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: org.apache.river.api.util.Startable
        Called after construction, this method enables objects to delay starting threads or exporting until after construction is complete, to allow safe publication of the service in accordance with the JMM.

        In addition to starting threads after construction, it also allows objects to avoid throwing an exception during construction to avoid finalizer attacks.

        The implementation is required to ensure start() is idempotent (only executed once, additional invocations must return immediately).

        Specified by:
        start in interface org.apache.river.api.util.Startable
        Throws:
        Exception - if there's a problem with construction or startup.
